title: Intake Research Analyst
description: Job Description: The Intake Research Analyst is responsible for conducting due diligence on potential and existing clients and associated parties to assist with the evaluation of new business under prevailing ethical rules and internal policies. The Intake Research Analyst proactively identifies risks and concerns to allow proper consideration by attorneys and Firm management. A hybrid work schedule is available for this position. A career at Nixon Peabody is the opportunity to do work that matters. It’s the chance to use your knowledge to shape what’s ahead. To share, to innovate, to learn at a firm that taps the power of collective thinking. We’ve created a dynamic, energizing environment that promotes success for our clients and each other. We offer fast growth, connectedness and training in business as well as law. And our rigorous standards assure you are part of a diverse team of top talent at every turn. If you’re someone who’s looking toward the future, we’d love to hear from you. Location: Boston, MA; Chicago, IL; Rochester, NY; Washington, DC Perform a high volume of timely and thorough online research, including review of litigation, media, sanctions, and other determinants of client worthiness. Gather, interpret, and accurately present an organized summary of relevant research findings to attorneys and staff to aide assessment of the Firm’s possible involvement with parties in connection with new and existing business, lateral hires and other special projects. Communicate with attorneys, secretaries, and team members to ensure accuracy and completeness of reports and due diligence to support informed decisions by attorneys, staff, and Firm management. Collaborate with teammates and others in the Firm with respect to larger and more complex projects. Strive to improve processes while taking initiative to identify issues and propose solutions. Remain current in research techniques and available resources relevant to providing high quality research. Strict adherence to confidentiality rules regarding client and Firm matters. Assist with special projects and ad-hoc requests. Perform other duties as assigned. To perform this job successfully, you must be able to perform each essential job responsibility listed above, satisfactorily, with or without reasonable accommodation. Nixon Peabody retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. The requirements listed below are representative of the skills and abilities required. 2-4 years of relevant work experience, preferably in a legal or professional services setting conducting research. Bachelor’s Degree required. General knowledge of legal terminology, litigation structure, and legal and business research processes and resources. Expert level of deductive reasoning, analytical thinking, and research skills. Proficient at filtering large amounts of data and clearly summarizing information into relevant findings. High attention to detail and accuracy skills. Ability to work under pressure and prioritize competing demands to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Strong computer skills. Skilled in searching online resources. Experience with Lexis and Westlaw a plus. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively interface with attorneys, management, staff, and external contacts at all levels. Demonstrated professionalism and customer service orientation. Ability to work independently and collaborate as part of a team. Ability to make sound decisions while using good judgement. Nixon Peabody LLP is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer: Disability / Female / Gender Identity / Minority / Sexual Orientation / Veteran. To comply with Federal law, Nixon Peabody participates in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are verified through this electronic system established by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Social Security Administration (SSA) to confirm their identity and employment eligibility. Please refer to the Notice of E-Verify Participation and the Right to Work posters on the Nixon Peabody Careers page for more information. In accordance with applicable Federal and State laws, the anticipated annual salary range for this position, depending on location, is as follows: Rochester, NY: $58,172 to $83,210 Chicago, IL: $66,898 to $95,691 Washington, DC: $69,807 to $99,851 Boston, MA: $69,807 to $99,851 In addition to a standard benefits package, this role may be eligible for additional contingent compensation based on an array of factors, including but not limited to: work performance, geographic location, work experience, education, and qualifications. Because such contingent compensation is not yet calculable or may be zero ($0) in some circumstances, the above-listed salary range(s) are Nixon Peabody’s good faith estimate of the annual salary(ies) it reasonably expects to pay for the position at the time of this posting.

title: Senior Wargaming Analyst
description: C5T Corporation is a Woman-Owned, Certified Service-Disabled, Veteran-Owned Small Business headquartered at Scott AFB, Illinois. Founded in 2005 by three veterans, we value practical, innovation-minded people with a passion for successful mission accomplishment. We bridge the gap between operational and technical domains. Our core values are: Integrity...Excellence...Patriotism C5T is currently seeking a Senior Wargaming Analyst to provide professional and functional expertise to USTRANSCOM Strategic Plans, Policy and Logistics Directorate (TCJ5/J4). Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Ensure USTRANSCOM and Joint Deployment and Distribution Enterprise (JDDE) equities are addressed in Joint/DOD, Combatant Command, and Service wargames. Leverage knowledge of joint doctrine, strategy development, and joint planning principles for wargame development. Develop wargames assessing deployment and distribution challenges in the future operating environment. Understand organizational policies and processes, and their impact on operations. Facilitate wargame design and scenario development with associated objectives, purposes, and end-states. Prepare USTRANSCOM wargame participants to provide realistic inputs. Provide assessments and recommendations to senior leadership and decision-makers on wargame findings, contributing to the development of effective defense strategies and policies. Qualifications Top Secret Level Security Clearance with sensitive compartmented information is required. The applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Master's Degree plus four (4) years' experience related to the field of work OR Bachelor's degree plus six (6) years related experience. Experience in lieu of education will be considered. Wargaming experience desired. Experience in major exercise planning and execution will be considered in lieu of wargaming experience. Professional experience must be in logistics, distribution, transportation, supply chain management, strategy, joint capability development, governance, and/or DoD strategy and concept development. Experience working on a senior level headquarters staff. Proficiency in Microsoft Office (including Outlook, Word, Excel, SharePoint and PowerPoint) is required. Analytical and problem-solving capabilities. All C5T team members must have strong interpersonal skills to interact with our customers and team members. Strong communication, leadership, and presentation skills along with analytical and problem-solving capabilities are a must. Benefits To show our commitment to our employees and their families we offer: Medical Insurance Benefits Options offered through United Health Care. Dental and Vision Insurance Benefits Options offered through Guardian. 401(k) Plan with company match Flexible Spending Account 10 Paid Holidays per year Responsible Paid Time Off (RPTO): C5T allows eligible employees the freedom to take time off for vacation and personal needs contingent upon fulfilling their work obligations, including meeting mission needs and enabling continued success for your team. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other similarly protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. EOE Minorities/Women/Disabilities/Veterans

title: Oracle EPM Reporting - Senior Analyst (Hybrid)
description: At HCSC, we consider our employees the cornerstone of our business and the foundation to our success. We enable employees to craft their career with curated development plans that set their learning path to a rewarding and fulfilling career. Come join us and be part of a purpose driven company who is invested in your future! Job Summary Job Description Under the direction of the Manager of Financial Business Intelligence the Principal – Oracle EPM Reporting analyst will analyzes the complex business problems being addressed by product, member, provider, regulatory and enterprise strategies, and new business cases and developing solutions for clients. The principal will have hands on development proficiency in reporting and analytics within the enterprise version of Oracle Fusion Cloud Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) is a must. Lead experiences in EPM with a focus on custom REPORTING on Narrative reporting, PBCS (planning), PCMS , Fin Consolidation & Close, Account Reconciliation, Enterprise Data Management (EDM) Will be responsible for designing reports using Reports (previously financial reporting), Narrative Reporting (management + Packages), SmartView (with VB excel), Dashboards (Account Reconciliation & FCCS). This role requires not only technical expertise but also strategic acumen to drive the EPM reporting capabilities within the organization, including providing guidance and recommendations to senior management around industry trends and new technologies. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Security, business & IT support to identify and deliver self-service & custom reporting solutions where feasible to empower end-users. Competency to plan & manage simultaneously multiple initiatives &/or reports of varying priority. Design efficient & scalable reporting solutions. Offer technical direction and expertise, adhering to reporting and technology best practices. Create and maintain meticulous design documents related to reporting deliverables. Design, develop, and maintain reports within the Oracle EPM & ERP SaaS Cloud. Self-service first mindset, else design standardized dynamic reports where possible to meet evolving needs. Streamline reporting delivery and usage, seeking opportunities for simplification & reduction in maintenance costs. Implement team resiliency by training team members on EPM reporting capabilities. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree with at least 8 years of experience working in a role which requires one of more of the following: business development, business analyst, innovation management, etc OR 12 years of experience working in a role which requires one of more of the following: business development, business analyst, innovation management. Recognized as an expert within HCSC 6 years consulting and/or industry experience. Anticipates internal and or external business challenges and/or regulatory issues; recommends process, product or service improvements Solves unique and complex problems that have a broad impact on the business Contributes to the development of functional strategy Leads project teams to achieve milestones and objectives Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirements. Knowledge to assist business areas in defining their information strategy. Experience using best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or services Experience developing business cases and related financial literacy to support cases, and ability to write business cases demonstrating future direction for leveraging information in the member, provider, product, and regulatory domains. Gather and document business requirements in support of information-related strategies Solve complex problems; take a new perspective using existing solutions Knowledge of various software development processes, including requirements gathering, analysis and design, and development, agile methodologies, and tools and technologies. Create and conduct presentations to inform and influence, with the ability to think laterally and creatively. Clear and concise verbal and written communication skills. Experience interacting successfully with management and staff across multiple departments. Proficiency with Microsoft Office (e.g. Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio) for written communication and analysis. PREFERRED JOB REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, Math, Economics, or Finance Experience in Fusion ERP analytics (FAW), FRS (ERP), BI Publisher (ERP) is a plus Experience in Alteryx, Tableau, PowerBI or other analytics tools is a plus Experience in Free Form/Groovy is a plus Experience in finance and healthcare industry. 1 Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at HCSC about our Employee Referral process! HCSC Employment Statement: HCSC is committed to diversity in the workplace and to providing equal opportunity and affirmative action to employees and applicants. We are an Equal Opportunity Employment / Affirmative Action employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug-free and smoke-free workplace. Drug screening and background investigation are required, as allowed by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Senior Compensation Analyst
description: A Robert Half client is seeking a Senior Compensation Analyst in Chicago, Illinois. The successful applicant will play a key role in the design, analysis, budgeting, and implementation of new compensation programs. Additionally, they will ensure that these programs are efficient and effective and remain competitive. This position offers a hybrid work arrangement with an expanding global company. Massive Growth Opportunity! Medical benefits paid for by the employer - Do not miss out on this one! Responsibilities Lead and participate in various compensation projects, including the design, analysis, budgeting, and rollout of new compensation programs. Conduct thorough analyses to assess the effectiveness, efficiency, and competitiveness of existing compensation structures, policies, and processes. Generate reports, dashboards, and metrics to pinpoint key trends and opportunities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and manage wage structures, incentives, and rewards programs to support organizational goals, pay equity, and transparency. Serve as a subject matter expert on significant compensation initiatives, identifying opportunities for enhancements in programs, policies, and procedures. Recommend and implement approved changes. Assist in the annual compensation planning cycle, including testing and ensuring the functionality of the compensation planning system. Develop models and perform analyses to support compensation programs, special projects, and the annual budgeting process. Create and support communication and change management efforts for compensation programs to enhance understanding across the organization. Partner with Legal, Finance, and Payroll teams to complete required pay equity compliance reporting. Prepare presentations, scorecards, trends, and graphical illustrations for leadership reviews of compensation programs. Collaborate with HRIS to ensure accurate updates regarding compensation-related HR data in the system of record. Act as a compensation expert on system implementations affecting compensation. Participate in compensation surveys across relevant regions, maintaining an up-to-date market data database with accurate job matching. Work with HR, Talent Acquisition, Talent Development, and people leaders to keep job descriptions current and market-aligned. Ensure all compensation programs comply with federal, state, and local regulations. Collaborate with the total rewards team on projects, such as developing total compensation statements. Mentor and collaborate with team members as an expert on compensation, recognition, and rewards programs. Participate in total rewards program surveys. Perform other duties and responsibilities as needed. Requirements: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Compensation role Bachelors Degree Strong understanding and experience in Compliance Experience in Annual Compensation planning and execution Knowledge of Compensation - International regulations and best practices Proficiency in Compensation Benchmarking and conducting Compensation Surveys Experience in Global Compensation strategies and implementation Demonstrated ability in Employee Recognition programs and initiatives Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data analysis and reporting.

title: Demand Planner
description: Position Summary: Demand Planner is responsible for all forecasting activities associated with products and customers. Demand Planner creates and maintains forecast models for their assigned products, incorporating forecast information gathered from sales, product management, and new product development. Additionally, this position will also be responsible for maintaining a strong partnership with domestic and international vendors through the PO management lifecycle process. The Demand Planner will be expected to lead the Demand Review meetings and establish an unconstrained consensus forecast as well as preparing for and leading the S&OP process. Responsibilities: Develop demand forecasts at multiple levels of aggregation. Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, and prepare forecast data. Develop statistical forecast models and evaluate forecast results. Interact with sales, product management, and new product development teams to understand demand forecast drivers. Utilize a collaborative approach to ensure current and accurate information is used for demand forecasts. Prepare Reporting Packages for different Business Segments. Lead the monthly Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP) process. Develop, maintain, and evaluate metrics, dashboards, reports, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Monitor and request supplier expedites according to planning and demand schedules; primary contact for assigned vendors. Review the system-generated MRP and various other reports to generate and track purchase orders based on item demand. Issue and update purchase orders/dates with domestic and/or international vendors. Extract and integrate data from multiple sources using tools such as Microsoft Excel. Utilize Business Intelligence tools for ad hoc analysis and reporting. Analyze data to provide detailed analysis supporting decision-making initiatives. Ability to convert strategic planning into tactical execution. Research, implement, and maintain best practices in demand planning. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting, or Finance OR any equivalent combination of education, experience, and training. 2 years of professional experience as an Analyst in Sales, Business, or Operations analysis in manufacturing or distribution. Proficient in Excel, Microsoft Office Suite, and JDE Oracle ERP system software. Strong skills in SQL, data warehousing, and forecasting methodologies. Ability to deliver organized presentations to business partners. Strong understanding of Business Analytics and Reporting principles. Demonstrated ability to define problems, research, collect data, and analyze business information. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of JDE Business software. We Provide: Competitive Compensation Package Company provided Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability. 401(k) Employer Match. Paid Time Off Programs Comprehensive Benefits Package. Team Member discounts on Visual Comfort Products. site Apply Now

title: EDI Analyst
description: Description We are seeking an EDI Analyst to join our team in the logistics industry, located in Bolingbrook, Illinois. This role is central to our technology operations, where you will ensure seamless data flow between multiple systems and partners using EDIs and APIs. You will play a key role in maintaining our service catalog featuring a large variety of pre-developed integrations into key systems, carriers, and customers. Responsibilities Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure smooth data flow Utilize various tools to investigate, develop, and troubleshoot integrations in a busy logistics environment Maintain the service catalog featuring pre-developed integrations into key systems, carriers, and customers Leverage EDIs and APIs to facilitate efficient data exchange Explain technical concepts in a comprehensible manner to non-technical users Conduct AB Testing to ensure the efficiency of data integration processes Perform Configuration Management to ensure system stability and performance Use your knowledge of ERP - Enterprise Resource Planning to optimize business processes Apply your skills in Microsoft SQL and Database management to handle data efficiently Document Business Requirements to guide the development of integrations and systems. Requirements Minimum 3 years of experience as an EDI Analyst in the logistics industry Proficient in handling EDI transactions Knowledge of ERP - Enterprise Resource Planning is essential Familiarity with EO/IR systems is required Proficiency in using Microsoft SQL database Experience in AB Testing is desirable Understanding of Business Process Functions Ability to create Business Requirement Documents Skills in Configuration Management Design skills and familiarity with 'Fi' are necessary Must have legal authorization to work in the location of the job. title: Senior Compliance Program Analyst
description: Help at Home is the leading national provider of in-home personal care services, where our mission is to enable individuals to live with independence and dignity at home. Our team supports 66,000 clients monthly with the help of 53,000 compassionate caregivers across 12 states. We’re looking for people who care about others, who are willing to listen, lean in and make impactful change. Each role at Help at Home can have a positive impact in supporting our caregivers and clients. If you are someone who leads with passion and integrity and are looking to join a rapidly growing, industry leading team, Help at Home may be a good fit for you. Job Summary The Senior Compliance Program Analyst is responsible for supporting the FSC-Corporate ethics, compliance, and privacy program (ECP) through data analysis and reporting key performance indicators to the Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer. This includes researching industry best practices and bench marking for program effectiveness relating to compliance, privacy, internal operations, and procedural compliance, analyzing, participating, supporting process improvement initiatives. Also maintain and follow-up on external surveys/audit tracker, compiling all plans of correction, any business development activity related to ECP. The Senior Compliance Program Analyst is responsible in leading and supporting on compliance key performance indicators of excellence. This position will work from their home office with quarterly travel to the Chicago, IL headquarters for on-site collaboration and department meetings. As a Key Member Of The Team You are flexible and can embrace change. You value progress over perfection. You care about your work, the team you are on, and the people we are helping. You make it a priority to get to know the people around you – build relationships with your colleagues and business partners. You say what needs to be said, while considering how it will affect culture and output. Hold others to a high standard. Essential Duties/Responsibilities: Under the direction of the Vice President, Compliance & Privacy Officer, this role will be responsible for identifying data trends, gaps, and areas of compliance risk for FSC-Corporate and Field Markets. To develop strategies and recommendations based on outcomes of data analytics. Maintain, manage, and analyze internal and external surveys/audits tracker. Collaborate and support the compliance leadership team on measuring effectiveness of the compliance program, gaps/trends, integration and recommend key performance indicators. Review gaps/trends, analyze and report on third-party compliance platforms that provide key data points for the ethics compliance program. Analyze gaps/trends on potential internal compliance process opportunities for improvement in the ethics compliance and privacy program. Assist and collaborating in obtaining gap closure plans by determining regulatory reporting requirements and keeping track of key compliance metrics. Regularly reviewing and reporting the Compliance Program effectiveness to the ethics compliance and privacy leadership team. Performing other duties as assigned by the Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer. Supervisory Responsibilities: None Education And Experience Bachelor’s degree required, master’s degree preferred in a related healthcare field or business. Experience in healthcare setting with a focus on data analytics, reporting and customer support in areas accreditation, compliance and regulatory five (5) years minimum. Exceptional attention to detail, problem solving and troubleshooting skills, and utmost confidentiality are required as part of this role. Ability to quickly identify trends/patterns and proactively respond. Experience in project management including planning, organizing, coordinating, and managing staff, clients, and/or partners towards the successful completion of a project. Knowledge and experience in state and federal regulations including HIPAA. Experience in Healthcare or related industry. PMO preferred, lean six (6) sigma certification preferred. Required Skills And Abilities Ability to juggle multiple critical projects and tasks while maintaining your day-to-day work. A minimum of five (5) years of direct data analytical skills and reporting Highly motivated, self-starter, team player, with positive attitude and strong quantitative, communication and relationship-building skills. Excellent Excel skills - i.e., ability to create basic pivot tables, Vlookups, etc. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Smartsheet, Vizio or related software program. Extremely organized with great attention to detail. Advanced project management skills with the ability to lead, facilitate, motivate, and organize. Ability to adapt to change. Ability to research, learn quickly and to creatively solve new problems. Ability to influence and settle differences quickly and peacefully. Potential for up to 10-20% domestic travel, as required Office Remote and office based in downtown Chicago Location: This position offers a flexible remote/hybrid work arrangement for candidates that are able to travel into the Chicago, IL office as needed. Physical Requirements Majority (90%) of work is conducted indoors in air-conditioned or well-ventilated facilities. The employee is generally subjected to long periods spent sitting, typing, or looking at a computer screen. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions upon request. Help At Home is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or religion or other legally protected status.

title: Business Development Manager-Retail Grocery, Midwest
description: Company Description Come join a growing team! FOODMatch is searching for a Business Development Manager-Retail Grocery to join our Sales department. FOODMatch is a producer and importer of Mediterranean specialty foods with a focus on olives, antipasti, and ingredients.Founded in 1996, FOODMatch is a producer and importer of Mediterranean specialty foods with a distinct expertise in traditionally and responsibly crafted olives, antipasti, spreads, sauces, and ingredients.FOODMatch plays an integral role in ensuring the quality of our products. The FOODMatch difference begins in the fields and groves. We are vertically integrated with our partners to ensure that each step along the production chain is completed to meticulous standards: from irrigation and pruning, to harvesting, sorting and stuffing by hand, to expertly curing and preserving, we ensure each ingredient delivers its natural flavor, color, and texture. Simply put, no detail is spared. Through the hands of our growers we create great tasting, responsibly produced, authentic foods that nurture community and enhance your quality of life. Summary , Job Description The ideal candidate has an aptitude for analytics and a desire to pursue sales. Background should include education and/or job experience in sales analytics and advanced excel skills. Familiarity with retail sales analytic software a plus. This company thrives on collaboration, and a good fit to the team would be someone able to simultaneously handle multiple projects at various stages, enjoys finding solutions with data and ability to craft a story with the results, as well as a willingness to help and pitch in at all levels. At times, this person may be involved with direct sales client interactions. Essential Functions SALES ANALYSIS AND REPORT CREATION Generate Quarterly/YOY reports providing insights and trends in our business Analyze sales reports from SPINSand other databases for regular business reviews, sales meetings, executive presentations, pitch meetings, etc. Develop PowerPoint presentations in support of ongoing Sales needs Manage customer/retailer portals for item management and sales reporting Assist with sales projections: analyze ordering trends and purchase history by customer SALES CRM MANAGEMENT Act as a point-person for ensuring valid, current, and cohesive information is consistently entered and updated in our sales CRM platform Leverage data and business knowledge to drive improvement and usage of the CRM Assist the sales team, when needed, withentering information or troubleshooting issues SALES SUPPORT Work with the Business Intelligence team to: Track retail price points and price changes in the market Track out of stocks and promotions to fully understand supply needs Assist sales team at customer trade show booths and in-store demonstrations Provide sales data for broker/customer reviews Conduct research for special projects , Qualifications Skill & Ability Requirements Meticulous attention to detail Advanced Knowledge of Microsoft Excel Excellent communication and analytical skills – written and verbal Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work across departments Additional Information Background Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in business, finance or related field preferred 2+ years’ analyst experience and/or customer service experience preferred Experience in the food industry or a knowledge of the FOODMatch product line is beneficial Travel Requirements This role requires occasional travel COVID-19 Safety Protocols All FOODMatch employees are required to be fully vaccinated. Employees must show proof of full vaccination at the time of hire. FOODMatch offers a comprehensive benefits package and competitive compensation based on experience. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Senior Financial Reporting Analyst
description: We are seeking a Senior Financial Reporting Analyst who is fully proficient in applying established standards and researching and resolving a wide range of complex problems with diverse scope in innovative ways. The ideal candidate should be able to tackle problems where precedent may not exist and demonstrate good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Gathers data and prepares documents required by TRATON Uses a formal process for appropriate data gathering, consolidation and analysis of financial data relative to the preparation of required reporting Ensures data integrity and proper accounting and works with auditors who support the review and audit of regulatory filings Gathers reference material concerning new and existing technical accounting literature to ensure compliance with TRATON policies in accounting and financial reporting Bachelor’s degree At least 2 years of accounting/financial reporting experience OR Master’s degree At least 1 year of accounting/financial reporting experience OR At least 5 years of accounting/financial reporting experience

title: Senior Analyst, People Change Management and Training
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com What You'll Be Doing You’ll be joining CIBC’s Business PMO, People Change Management team. You’ll work closely with others to manage a portfolio of projects from end-to-end, focusing on the people impacts. As the Senior Analyst, People Change Management, you’ll be joining a new team of people change professionals to manage and develop change plans for transformational initiatives and provide subject matter expertise to Project Managers during the project life-cycle. You’ll use your expertise in people/organizational change management methodology to make recommendations for continuous improvements on all project change deliverables and other change related practices. In addition, this role will be responsible for developing, delivering and maintaining content and materials to support changes to USCI business process and procedures and educating the Combined US Operations (CUSO) on people change management tools and best practices. Cross-Functional Relationships Interaction with CIBC business areas and key functional groups such as Risk Management, Legal and Compliance, Human Resources and Internal Audit. The role partners with US Learning & Development team to support training programs and/or initiatives impacting employees across the CUSO. Responsibilities Design content for training curriculum and materials in alignment with change management policy, standards, and process documents. Deliver training and communication to raise awareness and educate impacted colleagues on change management requirements across business lines and stakeholder groups. Maintain and deliver training curriculum in alignment with group’s requirements (e.g. change management methodology and governance, risk management policies, procedures, and standards). Advise initiative teams on communication and training standards aligned with established change management policy and practice. Develop and maintain the PCM SharePoint site and keep content (e.g., Tools, Templates, FAQs) current and up to date. Knowledge & Skills: At least 6+ years of people change management experience Bachelor’s degree required Expertise in delivering corporate training and communications Knowledge in Change Management / Project Management Knowledge of business units and project management processes Strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate and present to cross-functional stakeholders at all levels Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite Strong critical and strategic thinking ability Familiar with the Prosci and ADKAR How You'll Succeed Change management – Participate in the development of the People Change Management discipline for CIBC's US region. Provide best practices for CIBC based on your expertise. Assess the efficiency of the practices and procedures used by the team, and provide guidance that will continuously improve change capabilities. Teamwork – Help internal partners make informed decisions about the development of programs, products, and services. Work closely with teams as you work toward a common goal and negotiate deliverables and milestones whenever necessary. Communication - Provide visibility to transformational initiatives’ sequencing, planning and people change management components by performing analysis on skills and workforce, applying substantial communication and problem-solving skills Who You Are You embrace and advocate change. You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You’re inspired by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life. Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise. You have a degree/diploma in Business and/or a related field of study. It’s an asset if you have your MBA or professional designation. You can demonstrate experience in People/Organizational Change Management methodology, principles, and tools. It’s an asset if that experience is in Banking/Financial Services sector Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. What CIBC Offers At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client and to do it well. As part of our team, you will: Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and home. Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure foster innovation, collaboration, and creativity. Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training. Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits programs, retirement savings, and more. California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment What CIBC Offers At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck. We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a benefits program*, a vacation offering, wellbeing support, and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program. Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients. We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development. Subject to plan and program terms and conditions What You Need To Know CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit. We may ask you to complete an attribute-based assessment and other skills tests (such as simulation, coding, MS Office). Our goal for the application process is to get to know more about you, all that you have to offer, and give you the opportunity to learn more about us. Job Location IL-120 S LaSalle St, 11th Fl Employment Type Regular Weekly Hours 40 Skills Change Management, Change Management Processes, Communication, Deliverables Management, Delivery Management, Develop Training Programs, Initiating Change, Management Reporting, Process Improvements, Strategic Planning, Taking Initiative, Team Building Training, Teamwork, Training Evaluations, Training Instruction, Training Needs Assessment, Training Plans, Transformational Change

title: Lead ServiceNow SPM Analyst
description: Thank you for your interest in our Lead ServiceNow SPM Analyst position here at Ingredion! We are currently hiring for this opportunity, but will be aiming to begin the hiring process in August. In the interim we encourage talented people such as yourself to always connect. Please complete the application and share your CV. When we begin the hiring process for this opportunity, our Talent Acquisition team will contact you directly to discuss TITLE: Lead-ServiceNow SPM Analyst LOCATION: Westchester, IL REPORTS TO: Sr. Digital Portfolio Manager, Office of Chief Digital Information Officer Primary Function The Lead-ServiceNow SPM Analyst will play a key role in our IT PMO team. The Lead-ServiceNow SPM Analyst will be responsible for supporting the organization’s strategic portfolio management activities such as managing demands and resources using the ServiceNow platform. This role involves eliciting requirements, ongoing administration, and operationalization of the SPM module to meet business needs. Core Responsibilities Responsible for the day-to-day management and maintenance including Idea, Demand, Portfolio, Program, Project and Resource Maintenance, and ongoing administration of the SPM module. Collaborate with IT team members to operationalize and enhance the SPM Demand, Resource, Portfolio/Program/Project, and Timecard functionality and track associated KPIs. Collaborate with IT PMO and other stakeholders to elicit requirements and translate them into SPM end-to-end solution and build consensus among cross-functional teams. Provide subject-matter expertise in the discussions with key stakeholders in the development of business processes and metrics leveraging SPM features and drive adoption. Create & manage scorecards, dashboards, reports, and notifications along with SPM data health check and clean up. Conduct timely reviews with IT PMO to review Ideas, Demands and Resource Plans. Orchestrate Demand Management including advising and training Project Leads on Demand submission including Demand Assessment, Cost Plans, Benefit Plans and Resource Plans Provide training and support to end-users on the ServiceNow SPM module functionalities. Act as a liaison between the IT PMO and the larger ServiceNow Development team, reporting status and ensuring alignment with platform standards. Participate in the review of design artifacts to ensure alignment with the solution requirements and collaborate with stakeholders. Manage development work throughout the lifecycle from a unified product backlog of tasks including Sprint planning, reviews, and story refinement sessions. Work closely with the SPM development team to ensure accurate implementation of user stories and provide support for any clarification or adjustments. Communicate complex problems into easily understood requirements to the development team. Conduct review and approval of the solution requirements with relevant stakeholders. Create test cases and participate in testing activities, ensuring that the SPM module meets specified requirements and is free of defects including upgrades. Lead and participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the capabilities of the module. Independently research, where needed, to resolve and provide solutions to the end users. Develop and maintain documentation related to SPM processes, configurations, & reports. Qualified Candidates Will Have Aptitude for identifying issues and generating solutions to optimize SPM processes and workflows. Gather requirements, submit enhancements, prepare test cases, and conduct testing activities. Document business process and perform data analysis. Demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills to articulate complex problems and solutions to stakeholders. Ability to work in a team and independently. Demonstrate excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business needs into clear requirements. Demonstrate excellent presentation skills. Demonstrates innovative and strategic thinking. Exceptionally self-motivated, directed and detail oriented. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and work well under pressure, prioritizing and balancing competing tasks. Ability to adapt to emerging trends. Requirements Minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience with ServiceNow SPM module specifically managing Idea/Demand/Project/Program/Portfolio/Resource Plans/Timecard. At least 3 years of experience as a Lead/Senior Business Analyst working on SPM projects is required. Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related technical or business discipline is required. ServiceNow certifications related to SPM are highly desirable. ServiceNow ITBM/SPM developer experience is a plus. Strong understanding of the ServiceNow platform with a focus on Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) / IT Business Management (ITBM) modules. Previous experience leading adoption and of SPM. Familiarity with project lifecycle management from initiation to closeout is desired. Good understanding of IT Service Management (ITSM) processes. Ability to partner effectively with business professionals and internal/external IT professionals. Desired Certifications ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist – Strategic Portfolio Management (CIS-SPM): This certification is designed for ServiceNow System Administrators, implementers, users, and consultants who need to understand what Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) is, key processes and how does it function within the ServiceNow Platform. ServiceNow Certified Application Specialist – Performance Analytics: This certification assures employees and peers that you possess the skills and knowledge to apply advanced reporting, performance analytics, and application administration skills to use and administer the premium ServiceNow Performance Analytics application. ITIL Certifications: ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) certifications are a plus as they provide a practical framework for identifying, planning, delivering, and supporting IT services. Ingredion provides accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. If a job applicant requires an accommodation during the application process or through the selection process, we will work with the applicant to meet the job applicant's accommodation needs. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Ingredion seeks to provide a work environment that is free from harassment and discrimination. We will not tolerate any form of discrimination based on race, color, religion, age, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, handicap or disability—mental or physical—marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability resulting from military service, or any other classification protected by law (“protected classifications”). We are committed to establishing and maintaining a work environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect. Relocation Available: No

title: Sr. Marketing Performance Analyst (12-month Contract)
description: Why Glassdoor? When you work for Glassdoor, you help people everywhere get ahead in work and life. That's because we're moving fast to become the leading community for workplace conversations. Every day, we foster radical transparency by giving professionals a platform to connect authentically and anonymously. Think real talk with real people — plus company reviews and ratings, salary info, job listings and more. Join us as we make worklife better, together. Glassdoor is in search of a Senior Marketing Analyst to join our Marketing Analytics team. This is a month contract opportunity and in this role, you will play a pivotal part in fostering a data-driven culture, spearheading data analysis, and effectively communicating insights to key business stakeholders. Reporting directly to the Director of Marketing Analytics, the contract Senior Marketing Analyst will act as a key cross-functional collaborator. In this role, you will closely engage with various teams within the marketing department, aiding in their comprehension of the impact they generate. Additionally, you will collaborate with our Data Science team to ensure that our endeavors remain in sync with company objectives and tracking metrics. What You'll Do: Create data driven insights of the impact of our marketing campaigns Develop new approaches to grow our user base through data driven marketing optimization Collaborate with our marketing team to support campaign decisions Partner with our data science team to better understand our new user cohorts and user behaviors Act as a thought partner in defining the company's marketing key performance indicators and tracking progress against target metrics Mold data from multiple sources to answer key strategic marketing questions Partner with marketing operations and data engineering to influence and prototype backend data design, build intuitive and readable dashboards using visualization tools (e.g., Tableau), and extract actionable insights Work closely with the marketing programs team, business ops, and sales ops to build yearly and quarterly marketing forecasts & team goals. What You'll Bring: 5+ years experience in marketing and analytics roles Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills; must be very comfortable with data analysis and able to use data to make decisions Must have experience with performance marketing systems (Google Ads, Meta, TikTok, LinkedIn, etc.) Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets and bring an advanced proficiency in Tableau Strong expertise using SQL to extract, clean, and transform data in large, complex databases Expertise working with R, Python, or other statistical software preferred Ability to build strong relationships and work collaboratively with business stakeholders Exceptional attention to detail in executing complex and time-sensitive projects Strong communication skills, ability to develop a narrative and provide key insights Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Strong desire to add to our culture of diversity, equity and inclusion. Compensation Hourly range: $45.00 - $55.00 Our Commitments Come as you are: At Glassdoor diversity is not a slogan; it's a core factor in our success. We welcome your background, experience and ideas because you help us understand and better serve our world. You make us stronger. Grow your career: Glassdoor is small enough for you to see the impact of your contributions, while large enough to offer significant resources and endless opportunities to grow. This is a great place to make a career. Find your people: Ask anyone who works here: it's the people who make the difference. We are a group of well-rounded humans who support one another and work hard together to bring the Glassdoor mission to life. Discover flexibility: With flexible hours and a where-to-work policy, Glassdoor allows you to take on professional and personal responsibilities — enhancing both productivity and your well-being. Glassdoor is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection and employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or military status or any other category protected under the law. Glassdoor is an equal opportunity employer; committed to creating a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment and retaliation. Where-to-Work Policy Being a remote-first company, Glassdoor employees can live anywhere Glassdoor is a registered company. Requests to move must be approved by an employee's manager and the People team. While we will try our best to support relocation requests, some requests may not be approved due to various tax, legal, or other restrictions. Enjoy Remote and Explore: Employees authorized to work in their current location may Work Away for up to a total of 30 (thirty) working days in a calendar year without permanent relocation and compensation change. Employees on visas may work Work Away for up to a total of 20 (twenty) working days in a calendar year without permanent relocation and compensation change. The amount of time and location for Work Away must be approved by the employee's manager and People Operations team at least two (2) weeks in advance of travel.

title: Senior Analyst, SAP LE/WM
description: Job Type Full-time Description Job Title: Senior Analyst, SAP LE/WM Reporting To: Senior Manager, SAP Supply Chain Location: Chicago, IL Lactalis Heritage Dairy is currently seeking candidates to join our team in Chicago. Lactalis Group, the world leader in dairy, is a family-owned business with more than 85,000 pragmatic and ambitious professionals worldwide, committed to providing healthy and delicious dairy products that bring people together every day. At Lactalis, our core values of AMBITION, ENGAGEMENT, and SIMPLICITY are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re looking for a unique experience with a company that offers strong brands, professional expertise, and a dynamic work environment that champions entrepreneurial spirit, hands-on responsibility, and real opportunity for career development, we want to hear from you! Lactalis Heritage Dairy: inviting you to share with us your STORY, your PASSION, and your EXPERTISE. From your PASSION to ours Be a Technology team player at Lactalis! In this position you will play a key role in assisting leadership for the enterprise LE/WM used by the Supply Chain functions of the Lactalis US Business Units. You will be required to have both business process and technical skills to design, implement, test scalable solutions in SAP LE/WM/IM domain. The Sr Analyst SAP LE/WM role is responsible for support and enhancements solutions such as batch management, Serialization, handling units, cross docking, cycle counting, physical inventory, HUA’s, put away strategies, wave picking, EDI exposure, other 3rd party bolt on applications interfaces & MM/SD/QM integration. From your EXPERTISE to ours Key Responsibilities For This Position Include Strong hands-on SAP LE functional experience primarily in eWM, WM, shipping, and IM. Experience in decentralized warehousing, lean WM, Full WM, and Extended WM. Knowledge in advanced methods as wave picking, cross docking and kitting. 3+ Full cycle LE implementation including RF scanner set and management. EDI experience in with other external transportation/load management system messaging flow. Knowledge in posting changes, movement types, automatic TO and negative stock configurations. Exposure in PP interface with LE for-production supply areas, replenishment types and staging areas. Exposure in QM interface with LE for-inspection sample control and interim QM storage type set up. Solid experience in shipping/good receiving point determination configuration. Relevant experience in item category determination with batch management strategies configurations. Experience with split deliveries and subsequent delivery split configuration. Experience in transportation interfaces such TMS or other integrable application as ORTEC/3G. Solid understanding of partial shipment/final shipment in relation to deliveries within SD/LE. WM, MM and SD/LE output configuration (Transfer Order forms, Material document forms, Pick/Pack/BOL). Define and document processes, WRICEF, Functional Specifications, test plans/scripts and deployment plans. Daily support activities in such as create break fix tickets to trouble shoot, recommend new configuration, testing, business sign off and transportation into PRD procedures. Managed enhancement requests intake for customized reports/processes/quote gathering and discussion with business partners and senior management. Requirements From your STORY to ours Qualified Applicants Will Contribute The Following Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Business, or other related academic discipline. 5+ years’ experience in a large-scale, enterprise environment in SAP LE/WM. Experience in the Food Industry and/or Consumer Products is preferred. SAP S/4 HANA landscape and FIORI apps are preferred. Strong analytical, time-management and facilitation skills. Independent, self-motivated, self-managing, proactive and responsive with a bias for action and results. High level of personal integrity consistent with the client’s core values. Proficiency in support ticket and project management applications. Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Excel). Lactalis Heritage Dairy is an equal employment opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against applicants with regard to any legally-recognized basis including, but not limited to: veteran status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, and physical or mental disabilities.

title: Business Director - Enterprise Supplier Management (ESM)
description: West Creek 7 (12077), United States of America, Richmond, VirginiaBusiness Director - Enterprise Supplier Management (ESM) Strategic, Analytic and People leadership in a critical business unit of Capital One - building and shaping strategies for the global 3rd party ecosystem which accounts for billions in spend, and is on the precipice of material growth. As Business Director - Enterprise Supplier Management (ESM) you will drive the strategy, insights and analytics for a billion dollar global supply chain, while transforming talent, influencing technology investments, assessing risk and growing diverse supplier pools. You’ll team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. And you will do it all in a collaborative environment (working closely with experts in sourcing and operations) that encourages you to take on a critical leadership role, promote continuous learning, and reward innovation. General Responsibilities: Shape ESM Strategy and Talent Profile : Create strategic approach leveraging data and market-insights for billions of dollars in spend across a global footprint while also assessing risk strategies. Also, invest in talent elevation leveraging business analyst communities across Capital One Deal Negotiation Analysis: Reflecting the core historical responsibility of the ESM Analyst Team, ensure deal negotiation, financial analysis and related solutions lead to pricing and terms advantageous to Capital One that drives millions in value. Partner closely with Sourcing team on application of market intelligence Supplier Selection : Help eliminate arbitrary uniqueness in supplier selection, and increase timely access to capabilities that advance business strategy ESM Operational Analysis: Support problem solving to continuously improve processes especially to manage workflow (backlogs; turn around times etc.) Data Quality: Lead ESM data team to ensure accurate & accessible data for analytical purposes, while also influencing data-products on partner teams such as ESM product management Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree At least 7 years of experience in analysis Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree 2+ years of experience in financial services 1+ year of experience in consulting 3+ years of experience in people management Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website . Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level. This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days.No agencies please. Capital One is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender reassignment, citizenship, immigration status, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited under applicable federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City’s Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia’s Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com . All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site. Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).

title: Customer Service Analyst
description: Company Summary: Zoro is an eCommerce company that’s on a mission to help business owners get everything they need to run their businesses and thrive–from office supplies to power tools. But we’re way more than a website. We’re a team of great people with an award-winning culture. Check us out and see for yourself! Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled Customer Service Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a key role in ensuring the highest level of customer satisfaction by leveraging your strong analytical skills and business acumen to uncover insights by analyzing customer interactions, identifying trends and implementing strategies to improve our overall customer service experience. Duties and Responsibilities: Utilize statistical methods to analyze contact center data, including customer inquiries, feedback and concerns to identify trends and areas for improvement. Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance metrics such as contact center volumes, response time, first contact resolution rate and customer satisfaction scores. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop visualization dashboards that provide actionable insights and support decision-making processes. Conduct root cause analysis to identify underlying reasons for customer issues and develop proactive solutions to prevent recurrence. Assist in the planning and execution of weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual activities by providing data-driven recommendations and insights. Contribute to the development of programs, methodologies, and reports for analyzing and presenting data effectively. Write narratives around project performance to communicate findings and recommendations to internal stakeholders Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field. Master's degree is a plus. . 1-3 years Customer Operations, Supply Chain, Customer Service or Order Management experience. Proven experience in statistical analysis, trend identification, and data interpretation, preferably in contact center or customer service environments using tools like SQL, R, Python. Proficiency in data mining, visualization, and dashboard development using platforms like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel , or similar data analysis tools. Self-starter/learner that can drive cross-functional projects; strong ability to work under minimal supervision Excellent verbal and written communication skills Exceptional analytical skills, detail and goal oriented, collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, with a customer-centric mindset Preferred Qualifications: Strong problem solving & critical thinking skills, able to be fluid and adaptable to changing priorities and needs, fostering teamwork & collaboration. Demonstrated ability to build relationships supported by strong negotiation skills to resolve difficult issues and inspire change within and across functional departments High level of attention to detail while running several work-streams; committed to process improvement, with effective time management & organizational skills. Experience working with large volumes of data using advanced functionality in Excel and/Or Google Sheets- must be able to create v-lookup, pivot tables, etc Solid understanding of transactional systems and processes. (SAP/Netsuite/Other ERP) Familiarity with supply chain, logistics and customer service processes Positive and enthusiastic attitude Ecommerce related experience such as is a plus Zoro Values and Inclusive Culture: Zoro is dedicated to fostering an environment where people of all backgrounds and beliefs are represented and valued. We aim to empower all of our employees to learn about, raise awareness of, and promote diversity and inclusion through all of our workplace interactions. Zoro is a place where everyone can learn, grow, and thrive. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

title: Senior Support Analyst - R&D Operations
description: Company Description AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn. Job Description The Associate Service Consultant is accountable to improve the business/end user experience with a forward-looking mindset and spirit of continuous improvement. This includes: Delivering business value by maximizing financial investment and the sustainability of the application Managing through the Managed Service Providers to quality outcomes Ensuring alignment with cross functional teams and external parties In this role you will be responsible for: Demand and release change prioritization with plan build as required. Provides input and feedback into the Change, Release and Deployment processes and schedules ensuring minimal impact and downtime of changes to the business. Monitor and Approve Change Records for ACoE Owned Changes. Accountable for Demand Approval - ensures right change, right change type, clear & complete scope/requirements. Provide budgetary impact of proposed changes to plan organization and ensure transfer of budget and updates portfolio tracker. Accountable for ensuring that the Service Transition processes are fully executed. Approve readiness for support transition and serves as escalation point for any delays in service transition Primary point of accountability with fulfillment of Audit Artifact Service Requests. Coordinates with internal compliance team for internal compliance driven audit requests. Monitors MSP execution of Audit process and procedures. Ensures timely and accurate delivery of external compliance driven audit artifacts. Govern the application recertification process occurs as scheduled. Provide audit results as needed. Evaluates and Approves the Service Providers reported performance trends and the process improvement recommendations to identify areas where preventative maintenance might be performed to improve Applications performance and efficiency. Reviewing ticket patterns and identifying opportunities that were presented by their MSP. Approves SLA exception breaches. Responsible for reviewing the service provider Service Level Agreements and participating in any action plans that are required to address any deviations and/or improvement opportunities with the supplier. Helps manage the relationship with vendors to ensure superior service delivery for all application maintenance and support activities. Performs summary daily reviews of prior days ticket activity: queue levels, processing efficiency, backlogs, aging levels along with prior day Incidents and adjusts priorities as needed to ensure that ticket processing and the Problem Management engines are performing within expected operational parameters. Acting approver for SLA exception breaches. Serves as primary AbbVie contact point and first level of escalation for Incidents and Problems., including activities that require multiple teams to solution. Assists, when needed, with the prioritization and escalation of system recovery issues with Cross-functional, Build and Infrastructure teams. Qualifications Tools and skills you will use in this role: Microsoft Office Suite Interpreting technical languages for business partners ITIL Experiences that make you a good fit in this role: Required: Bachelor’s Degree with 6 years’ experience; Master’s Degree with 5 years’ experience; PhD with 0 years’ experience. Proven experience with Application outsourcing and terminology such as Minor Enhancements, ARC’s/RRC’s, Service Level Management and Vendor Management. Prior experience with systematically and logically interpreting data, including analyzing trends, solving complex problems, and presenting recommendations to management. Prior experience managing changes and change control processes and methodologies. Proven experience managing and executing complex IT processes and demonstrated ability to identify exceptions to the process, or potential process improvements. Experience with identifying and executing continuous improvement opportunities and cost reduction initiatives. Experience facilitating cross-functional meetings and demonstrated ability to effectively communicate both written and verbally. Beneficial: Experience with Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies. Knowledge of (could be a platform or a vertical such as Oracle, or Life Sciences Pharmaceutical Research and Development or Financial application technologies, etc.). Ability to prioritize and multi-task. Strong problem resolution skills. Ability to influence key stakeholders to adopt innovative technology solutions in support of their strategic agenda Experience in learning a new business and building both horizontal and vertical relationships with business and IT leaders Proven experience with ITIL, specifically Incident and Problem management as well as Continuous Improvement Planning (CIP), Cost Optimization, Demand and Release and Deployment Management. ITIL Foundation Certification. ITIL Intermediate Certification in Service Operations. Experience developing and implementing Operating Level Agreements (OLA’s). Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional teams towards task completion. Experience with Service Operations in a global, multi-sourced environment. Why Business Technology Solutions For anyone who wants to use technology and data to make a difference in people’s lives, shape the digital transformation of a leading biopharmaceutical company, and secure sustainable career growth within a diverse, global team: we’re ready for you. Additional Information Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable.
