title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description: Job Summary We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Business Analyst to join our Marketing team at i3 Broadband. This pivotal role involves extensive work with large data sets, providing crucial insights to support our marketing strategies and sales efforts. The successful candidate will be deeply involved in data manipulation, analysis, and modeling, offering actionable intelligence to guide decision-making processes in our fast-paced telecommunication environment. Duties/Responsibilities Reporting on the Marketing departments defined key performance indicators. Analyzing online marketing trends, collecting, and analyzing industry data, optimizing, and reporting campaign performance. Develop insights that drive Marketing decisions and improve lead quality. Collecting and processing large data sets from various internal and external sources. Conduct comprehensive data analysis using advanced Microsoft Excel skills, ensuring accuracy and effectiveness in handling, manipulating, and pulling large data sets. Develop and implement regression models using multiple large data sources to predict trends and outcomes. Lead customer segmentation modeling, understanding, and applying demographic frameworks to target specific customer groups effectively. Synthesize and distill large data sets to provide supported insights, translating complex data into understandable and actionable information for the marketing and sales team. Collaborate with various departments to align marketing strategies with broader organizational goals, utilizing data-driven insights to inform decisions. Communication findings and insights to stakeholders using data visualization and storytelling techniques. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop data-driven strategies and make informed decisions. Ensuring data quality, accuracy, and consistency in a timely manner. Ensuring compliance with data privacy and security regulations. Required Skills/Abilities: Must be able to work productively and effectively in a collaborative team environment. Strong business acumen. Organizational, project, and process management and leadership skills Written and verbal communication skills, including delivering presentations. Business process analysis skills. Attention to detail and quantitative analytical skills. Computer skills in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) Results orientations/Sense of urgency Problem-solving and decision-making. Customer focus/Sales growth Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, Math, Statistics, Economics, IT, or a related field required. 5 years of marketing analysis experience required or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 5 years of work experience in an analytics-focused role with experience in digital marketing. Must have Microsoft Excel EXPERT Certification Use and knowledge of Marketo, PowerBI, Smartsheets, Google 4 Analytics, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and other social media platforms. SAS Programming knowledge and data analytic support abilities including data extraction, cleansing, match/merging, and loading processes. Knowledge and hands-on experience with at least one database, ideally SQL server

title: Senior Claims Operations Analyst
description: Why Crawford? Because a claim is more than a number — it’s a person, a child, a friend. It’s anyone who looks to Crawford on their worst days. And by helping to restore their lives, we are helping to restore our community - one claim at a time. At Crawford, employees are empowered to grow, emboldened to act and inspired to innovate. Our industry-leading team pioneers new solutions for the industries and customers we serve. We’re looking for the next generation of leaders to take this journey with us. We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve. Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in purpose, vision and values. Learn more at www.crawco.com. When you accept a job with Crawford, you become a part of the One Crawford family. Our total compensation plans provide each of our employees with far more than just a great salary Pay and incentive plans that recognize performance excellence Benefit programs that empower financial, physical, and mental wellness Training programs that promote continuous learning and career progression while enhancing job performance Sustainability programs that give back to the communities in which we live and work A culture of respect, collaboration, entrepreneurial spirit and inclusion Crawford & Company participates in E-Verify and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/D/V Crawford & Company is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Crawford via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written Statement of Work in place for this position from Crawford HR/Recruitment will be deemed the sole property of Crawford. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Crawford as a result of the referral or through other means. Provides subject matter expertise on various complex projects that are assigned to Business Support Services for handling to completion i.e., Take Overs, Reverse Take Overs, Novations/Buybacks, Carrier program Funding Conversions, and claim Split Billing processes Coordinates and monitors the completion of all tasks among various operational areas in relation to complex operational projects Acts as subject matter experts for the analysis and evaluation of claim systems, software, equipment and programs and provides recommendations for implementation. Assists in the development, testing, and implementation of new and existing programs, procedures, and system enhancements in support of Broadspire Claim and various business departments Develops and maintains a favorable working relationship with internal and external customers Coordinates claim system related tasks in conjunction with Finance team for any Break Payment items; maintains and monitors monthly list of clients that are on break payment and reasons Determines and creates appropriate user access to the Lotus Notes User Distribution Groups Provides direction to the Claim department for any questions related to handling of Prefund requests and the claim system process impacts Provides additional user level expertise to ICT Help Desk Support for claim system issues Oversees ISOVerisk Vendor relationship; i.e., maintains ISO account list, user access IDs, distribution of any ISO error reports, and managing annual fee structure and new product implementation Analyzes, research and write internal procedural changes, workflows and requirements in support of various business areas Determines business impact and recommends and/or initiates appropriate action Participates in the research, writing, publishing and maintenance of operating procedures and user manuals Provides guidance and/or training to Claim Offices on existing claim systems and procedures Provides assistance to various Broadspire Departments identifying, researching and correction of indicative and financial data errors Maintains applicable log books as well as adheres to established guidelines of applying reimbursements to claim files and/or mailing of reimbursement/miscellaneous checks to appropriate lockbox Provides backup coverage to others in Claim Operations as needed and/or requested. Maintains professional and positive relationship with Boadspires’ File Storage Vendor, including ensuring payment of fees and user requirements related to access IDs, file retention, as well as responding to various business area questions or issues Participates in ad hoc assignments and special projects as assigned Upholds the Crawford Code of Conduct Three or more years of experience in Broadspire Business Support Services, Claim Systems or Claim Operations or the equivalent, demonstrating a good knowledge of claim systems and field operations. Education equivalent to graduation from college or the equivalent in related work experience. Demonstrates effective customer relations skills. Demonstrates sound analytical skills. Demonstrates a comprehensive knowledge of claim system functions and the relationship of client information to accurate claim processing and reporting. Demonstrate ability to work accurately with attention to detail and customer expectations. Demonstrate effective and diplomatic oral and written communications skills

title: Portfolio Manager - Team Lead (Wealth Management)
description: Salary Range: $121,800 - $203,000 annually At Midland States Bank, base salary is one component of our Total Rewards program. Exact compensation is determined by factors such as (but not limited to) education, skills, internal equity, and experience. This position offers additional compensation in the form of short-term incentives (i.e. bonus and/or commission) and may include long-term incentives (i.e. stock awards). Benefits for this role include comprehensive healthcare, well-being benefits, paid family leave as well as generous paid time off. Total Rewards also include banking perks, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, 401K plan with company match and may include the opportunity to participate in our Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation plan. Incentives and benefits are subject to eligibility requirements. Position Summary The Portfolio Manager Team Lead will provide discretionary management for the most complex trust and high net worth portfolios in accordance with clients’ unique needs, governing documents, firm guidelines and fiduciary standards. The Team Lead is an integral driver in the development and monitoring of the Bank’s investment strategy as well as the construction of the fixed income and/or equity portfolios. This position is a leadership role. Primary Accountabilities People Manages a team of professionals in a customer-centric culture to excel in a fast-paced environment. Coaches, develops, and conducts performance management activities with direct and indirect reports. Identifies high-potential employees for advanced training and development opportunities. Effectively manages poor performers. Client Engagement Establishes investment objectives, articulates tailored investment strategies, and provides recommendations and explanations of account performance. Leads the development and maintenance of client equity portfolios, conducting research and providing mentorship to Research Analysts. Effectively communicates and promotes our investment philosophy to clients, prospects, and centers of influence. Leads the Senior Portfolio Managers and Portfolio Managers in ensuring consistent client communication aligned with the broader investment team’s views. Collaborate with Relationship Managers and Wealth Advisors to develop new business through clear communication of solutions and value propositions. Assists in coaching of Advisors on the Registered Investment Advisor (RIA) platform, fostering shared success in managing and growing their business. Serves as a subject matter expert in annuities, fixed income, equities, and various types of liquid and illiquid private assets to provide recommendations for complex portfolio solutions. Works closely with the financial planning team to integrate investment solutions into the financial planning process and ensure proper communication to clients. Maintains a current awareness of new investment strategies and instruments through regular contact with industry professionals and personal research. Identifies and refers business opportunities to other areas within the Bank as appropriate. Provides quality service in meeting customer needs, inquiries, and problem resolution. Develops content for investment newsletters, internal/external information pieces, and presentations in collaboration with third party sources. Other Strictly adheres to compliance and operational risk controls in accordance with Bank and regulatory standards. The role requires occasional travel for training and team meetings, and willingness to travel periodically, to locations within market as needed. May require work in a Midland office to ensure collaboration and support of internal and external customers. Maintain compliance with all applicable regulations including, but not limited to, the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA). Other duties as assigned. Position Qualifications Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferable in business or finance related studies. Advanced degree or professional certifications preferred (i.e. MBA, CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst), CIMA (Certified Investment Management Analyst), etc.) 10 or more years previous experience in investment management. Minimum 7 years experience in portfolio management that required making investment recommendations relied upon by others. Minimum of 5 years of experience leading teams with demonstrated success coaching and motivating team members. Skills in equity analysis, risk management, asset allocation, financial planning, portfolio construction, investment product due diligence and investment research. Expert level understanding of investments and portfolio management strategies, Modern Portfolio Theory, Prudent Investor Rule and Uniform Trust Code. Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to instruct others, interpret documents, and write reports and correspondence. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Ability to deal with complex problems involving multiple facets and variables in non-standardized situations. Competencies Business insight Cultivates innovation Drives results Makes sound decisions Being a brand champion Collaborates Communicates effectively Customer focus Being Authentic Emotional Intelligence Self development Being flexible and adaptable At Midland States Bank, we believe that when we can bring our whole selves to work each day, we become happier, more comfortable, more confident and more excited to do great things for our customers, each other and our company. We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. At Midland, we recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. If you are looking for a place to grow, we encourage you to apply at Midland States Bank, because you belong here. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to Midland States Bank Human Resources at HR@midlandsb.com . THIS JOB DESCRIPTION DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A CONTRACT FOR EMPLOYMENT

title: Senior Financial Analyst and Underwriter
description: This position requires one to lead by example and communicate to constituents outside the company in a fashion consistent with the culture and values of the company. Our company culture emphasizes and promotes teamwork, ownership in all that we do, entrepreneurialism, a strong work ethic, initiative, honesty, integrity, trust, and customer service. This role will work on healthcare transactions (including SNFs, ALFs, ILFs, and similar entities). Our organization will depend on your knowledge, skills, and attention to detail to ensure successful outcomes. Responsibilities Assist in the underwriting process for all internal and external acquisition Financial responsibilities include: Spread and analyze historical financial performance Assist in creation of detailed pro forma which include profit and loss by downloading/acquiring data from CMS and Operators. Ensure Real Estate Taxes are paid timely Construct ROI models/valuation matrixes Create projected cash flow and balance sheets (if applicable) Create accounts receivables aging analysis (if applicable) Prepare investment memoranda with supporting materials including transaction documentation. Asset Management Responsibilities Spread monthly financial performance on each asset under management Assist with deal pipeline along with acquisition, due diligence and closing. Create, maintain and track KPI models on all assets Review and stress test operating budgets for accuracy. Liaise and manage relationships with tenants/lenders or operators on a regular ongoing basis. Including monthly calls with tenants to review performance trends. Draft quarterly investor and management reports per portfolio Review insurance policies and requirements. Negotiate lease or loan terms with potential operators/lenders and tenants. Liaise with finance partners on an ongoing basis and submit all required data (compliance certificates, census, survey results, etc.) Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or Real Estate/equivalent professional work experience. At least 2 years prior experience in Skilled Nursing, multifamily and / or real estate management in an operator or institutional environment 4+ years experience in a related position in financial analysis, investment analysis, investment management, corporate finance, investment banking, private equity, or management consulting. Experience in construction management and oversight of value-add renovations preferred. Required Skills Intermediate Computer literacy skills (Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Adobe) Advanced Excel skills required. Candidate must be able to develop and work with complex multi-page spreadsheets and workbooks. Demonstrate leadership, organizational skills, and maintain a positive and professional attitude Candidate should possess project management skills, ability to prioritize tasks and maintain numerous projects. Excellent analytical skills, problem solving skills, and ability to obtain, process and analyze financial data. Solid accounting skills are necessary. Ability to work well under pressure, meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks simultaneously with attention to detail.

title: Senior Logistics Analyst
description: Our client, a fast-growing company offering supply chain solutions, is looking to hire a Senior Logistics Analyst for their office in Schaumburg. This is a full time, hybrid position offering a competitive salary. Senior Logistics Analyst Responsibilities: Work closely with carrier development to ensure KPIs are being met Provide recommendations to optimize fleet, rail, vessel options Analyze and look at market and trends in order to stay updated on market values for customers Root cause analysis for the logistics suppliers and partnerships within the network Senior Logistics Analyst Requirements: 3+ years of experience in over-the-road pricing analysis Intermediate Excel proficiency required Experience in market and trend analysis If interested in this Senior Logistics Analyst position and qualify per the above requirements, please apply today! Thank you, Molly Murphy Project Manager, Supply Chain LaSalle Network LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v. LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.

title: Executive Director
description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. The Opportunity - We are currently seeking an Executive Director to join our Value and Risk Advisory team. Our Value and Risk Advisory platform is part of a global network comprised of experienced, licensed, qualified commercial real estate appraisers who use local insights and their years of expertise to deliver accurate, reliable and prompt valuations. We provide sound advice, no matter the size of a property, complexity of a project, or industry focus. Our professionals offer a full range of expertise, including counsel in financing, due diligence, risk analysis, financial reporting, dispute resolutions and equity offerings. The successful candidate will complete assignments in connection with commercial real estate valuation and consulting projects which may include analyzing complex highest and best use scenarios, estimation of cash flows utilizing discounted cash flow models, analyses of comparable sales and cost analyses. Responsibilities Include Focus on management of team members, workflow and delivering superior client outcomes Must be able to complete an entire report, cover to cover, to a “client ready” standard Partner with VAST member(s) to properly leverage support and be accountable for reaching utilization goals for the entire team Only inspect properties for tier 1 clients, where client interaction can be a benefit to growing the business, and/or if coaching an analyst Responsible for originating 30% of team volume Regularly attend leadership loop: accountable for ensuring team members receive messaging Responsible for managing account receivables on work personally originated Present at a local AI/IRWA/ULI/etc. Event (in addition to prior CRE community requirements) or publish an article in a trade magazine Represent JLL brand: optimism, intelligence and collaboration. Drive local presence and be the “go to” expert for your respective sector(s) Provide solutions Education Requirements Continue participation in JLLU to focus on career path alignment and building professional skillset, including people management and business development Master Argus competency (for team members of the national institutional team) Complete comprehensive exam and demonstration report within no greater than 18 months of being elevated to team lead, and submit application to AI Skillset Requirements Successfully master all Senior Director skillset requirements Full competency at project management and/or account management skills, beginning competency at business development skills Licensing Requirements State certified general appraiser license Maintain state licensing for specific geographic focus and pull temporary practice permits when required Minimum 5 years of holding CG license Sign reports Management Scope Recruiting team members Manage five individuals or more, preferred Partner with (coach) analyst i's, senior analysts, associates, associate directors, and/or directors to complete assignments Accountable for analysts & senior analysts achieving educational and licensing goals; along with ensuring production goals are met by all team members Our Team's Commitment To Diversity, Equity And Inclusion Globally, our teams have participated in Conscious Inclusion and Unconscious Bias Training. Our Business Resource Groups, comprised of more than 7,500 people across 200 locations, create a community of diverse perspectives, and connect people globally across the organization. We are seeking candidates who share our interest in joining at least one of JLL's 9 Business Resource Groups (BRG) which fosters a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Affiliation to each BRG is open to all employees—allies welcome in all groups. The Current List Of Business Resource Groups Are Asian Business Professionals Network Building Pride Business Network Disability Empowerment Network Empower - Black Professionals Network GenAll, Intergenerational Business Network Latino Empowerment Resource Network Parent and Caregivers Experience VetNet Women's Business Network

title: Category Analyst
description: About Ruby Company Est. in 1966, The Ruby Company is a national produce, distribution, and supply company that builds partnerships between growers and commercial purchasers to deliver the best product consistently and with integrity. We believe in an ethical and transparent business model in which we have skin in the game, investing not only in our team and capabilities, but in the relationships, we build with our customers and growers. Since opening our doors, we have built a strong reputation through performance and relationships. We are searching for motivated, hard-working, and driven individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit to join our fast-growing team. Don’t just take any job, build your professional career right here at The Ruby Company. About The Team The Business Intelligence team is a newly developed department within the organization focused on servicing and adding value both internally and externally by leveraging data and analytics. We believe that servicing our customers is the lifeblood of our brand and what differentiates us from our competition. We are currently looking for candidates who share our vision and passion for success through hard work and best-in-class execution. We value each member of the team and prioritize culture that brings out the best in our team. We have a casual dress code, open door policy as well as an energetic, friendly and supportive work environment. Job Description As Category Analyst you will act as an interface between sales, marketing, business development, and strategic accounts by leveraging analytics and research to develop category management/strategic solutions that drive profitability and category growth. This individual is responsible for managing, analyzing, and developing fact-based reporting tools to deliver concise and actionable recommendations. As Category Analyst, you will leverage the category management process as a decision platform for prescriptive initiatives designed to optimize distribution, price and category growth. In this role, you will deal with business data (Internal and external), including performing data extraction, transformation, modelling and data visualization. Additionally, you will be responsible for building dynamic reports, dashboards and scorecards. Core Responsibilities Leads the development and management of analytical reporting to support internal operations and requirements associated with strategic customers. Support the execution of special projects, ad hoc analysis, and initiatives by leveraging data and analytics. Develops thought leadership by translating knowledge and data from a variety of sources into forward thinking insights that form the basis for new or evolved strategic direction Interacts with cross-functional teams internally and with strategic customers Identifies opportunities and recommended actions by conducting market analyses of category for strategic customers and account teams Conducts periodic category reviews (Strategic Customers) Supports the development of sales presentations for sales and business development teams utilizing a category perspective Develop best-in-class scorecarding for both internal and external use Ideal Candidate Skills, Experience, And Qualifications 2 to 4 years in Report Writing and Dashboards from scratch Proficiency with Microsoft SQL Strong experience with Power BI for data modeling and creating dynamic visualizations Strong experience with Data Extraction and Data Mining Bachelor’s degree or relevant post graduate work experience, preferred Experience in category management, data, analytics, reporting and development, strongly preferred Professional, prompt, and polished written and verbal communication skills Advanced excel skills required Persistent work ethic and self-motivation Ability to thrive in a “start-up” esque environment Ability to achieve goals independently and in a team environment Ability to be resilient in a high-energy, fast-paced, and competitive setting What We Have To Offer Competitive base salary plus an aggressive bonus plan Full health benefits and 401k matching Energetic, fun, and friendly work environment Limitless growth potential Casual dress code Open door policy – strong engagement and connectivity with company leadership Compensation Salary + Bonus The Ruby Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

title: Operations Manager
description: Company Details Berkley Construction Solutions (BCS) offers lead and excess liability capacity to the commercial construction industry. Our team of dedicated, experienced excess construction specialists underwrites practice and project business for medium to large contractors across the U.S. At BCS our guiding principles are authenticity, trust and passion. The team culture is inclusive, high energy, and fun. Company URL: https://www.berkleycs.com/ The company is an equal opportunity employer. Responsibilities The Operations Manager is involved in all aspects of underwriting operations. This position will report to the Chief Information Officer and will assist the BCS Executive Team with executing their strategic vision for bringing together underwriting and technology. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast paced “start-up” environment and will apply advanced business and workflow knowledge to lead the organization’s functional and operational initiatives. They will manage the full reporting process, including data collection, database design, and dashboard/report creation. The duties and responsibilities will evolve as the business develops. Leading the transition from manual processes into integrated underwriting solutions. Responsible for the processes associated with policyholder service and support activities. Create and update formalized Operations Guidelines, Best Practices documentation, updates, and metrics. Identify enhancements to operational procedures to improve performance and reduce technical or operational difficulties. Assist with establishing and managing relationships with all third-party vendors and internal stakeholders. Work closely with the Business Analyst team to foster ideas to improve efficiencies with our processes and product and assist in prioritizing project work. Coordinate and/or perform compliance functions as identified. Maintain controls that verify the integrity of al systems, processes, and data. Manage strategic data initiatives including: Data analysis to identify areas for process improvement, innovation, and opportunities for operational efficiency and synergy. Facilitating internal report design and delivery using Power BI. Directing data fluency initiatives and integrations across all BCS departments. Researching and solving data integrity issues. Other duties, as assigned. Qualifications Strong customer service skills and ability to develop and maintain quality relationships with internal customers, such as underwriters and underwriting assistants, internal IT, claims, finance, premium audit personnel as well as external partners at BTS, third-party vendors and with other WRBC Operating Units, as needed. Knowledge of InsurTech and advanced technological environment, including Generative AI, Large Language Models, Intelligent Automation, and API frameworks. Continuous improvement mindset. Ability to research rules, manuals, and problem solve for solutions. Education Requirement Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field, required, Master’s degree, preferred Additional Company Details We do not accept any unsolicited resumes from external recruiting agencies or firms. The company offers a competitive compensation plan and robust benefits package for full time regular employees. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Sponsorship Details Sponsorship not Offered for this Role

title: Analyst, Licensing (Marketing)
description: Job Description Our mission in licensing at Kraft Heinz is to accelerate growth for the company and its iconic brands. We have a marketer’s mindset – with the brand and its consumers at the center of everything we do. Our team has the vision to innovate – embracing new ideas with the passion and enthusiasm to meet business challenges head on. Driven by insights, we’ve built a strategic framework that is rooted in core brand strategies and jobs to be done. We support our brands by leveraging extendable equities, stretching our brands into new channels/aisles, and creating unique partnerships and creative marketing opportunities that deliver on both brand and business objectives. Our work is focused, guided, and impactful so that creativity can flourish – effectively. As an Analyst, you will lead the outbound licensing operations and strategic partnership execution as a highly collaborative member of our licensing team in the North America Growth Office. As the keeper of this crucial component, you will assist with the implementation of internal tactical licensing strategies and conduct quarterly business reviews to ensure all work is supported by robust evaluation and measurable KPI’s that directly connect back to the strategic goals & objectives. You’ll be a champion and subject matter expert for all things licensing as you work cross-functionally to define what success looks like across the organization. Your responsibilities will span from compiling insights and sharing category/retail wins, to leading special projects and assisting with concept ideation and the product development process. You’ll work closely with our agency and licensing partners to handle day-to-day requests while managing the pipeline calendar to ensure all key stakeholders are aligned on launch plans and go-to-market strategies as we aim to push projects across the finish line efficiently and drive long-term growth for our licensing program in North America. Key Components of the Role Understand Kraft Heinz’ corporate brand purpose, vision, values and leadership principles, and ensure those are translated to all licensing & partnership efforts Contribute to developing the short- and long-term vision and growth opportunities for our licensing program in North America, in support of the Kraft Heinz 10 Year Strategy and all brands in our portfolio Analyze and report on licensing business performance, marketing/partnership analytics, sales/revenue trends and drivers (by brand, by partner, by category, by retailer, etc.) Support translation of data into insights, working closely with our agency and licensing partners to compile and analyze quarterly/mid-year/annual business reviews, product/retail wins, forecasting, etc. Become knowledgeable on all brands in our portfolio, their marketing strategies, brand priorities, jobs to be done, and how they connect directly to our winning licensing strategy Become knowledgeable of all our licensing partners, including their products, distribution channels, and be a resource internally and externally for all things licensing Become familiar with licensing industry trends & best practices, especially among corporate brands in food & beverage Manage/direct day-to-day licensing operations, requests, Visual Identity/style guides, product development, & maintain/build KHC's roster of licensing and partnership contacts Support Kraft Heinz Finance teams and work with our agency to ensure quarterly royalty reports & payments are collected timely, and allocated properly Lead day-to-day licensing budget management and PO creation Qualifications Proven experience in marketing preferred (licensing experience a plus) Accurate and timely reporting with the drive to improve and streamline processes Passion to learn industry best practices and benchmarks, understanding the dynamics, and strategic value and benefits of licensing in order to prioritize projects and opportunities Strong communications skills to work efficiently with internal parties (BU, Legal, QA, etc.) Strong process orientation to ensure proper quality, safety protocols are followed (DSA, Plant Audit, 3rd party consumer safety evaluation, etc.) Excellent organizational skills, self-starter and ability to meet deadlines and balance multiple projects and priorities Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail Ability to clearly and concisely relay important details and updates, and be a valuable resource as a licensing subject matter expert Location(s) Chicago/Aon Center Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Senior Analyst - Aggregation
description: When you’re the best, we’re the best. We instill an environment where employees feel engaged, satisfied and able to contribute their unique skills and talents while living and working as their authentic selves. We provide extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, building both employee competence and organizational capability to fuel exceptional performance through an inclusive environment both now and in the future. Summary In this role, you will represent the foundation of a larger decision matrix used by aggregation groups to make informed decisions about supply purchases and contracting. You will take raw data, cleanse it, organize it and generate reports in a way that tells a story. Responsibilities Analyze purchase order line-item data, submitted by member organizations, to determine if the dataset is complete. Mine data for missing spend. Use sound judgment to correct inaccurate line items. Build cross-references from existing national contracts and cross reference databases. Apply appropriate price and benchmark data as available. Customize analyses to meet customer needs. Interpret results and providing key insights that will help members make informed decisions. Communicate schedule, workload, progress and expected time to complete projects. Load price files for customers upon request. Expand category knowledge through experience, research, and networking. Remain cognizant of industry changes and challenges that may affect member decisions. Establish strong working relationships with internal and external partners. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in a related field. 5 or more years of relevant experience required. Experience in an analytical role, preferably working with healthcare supply chain or clinical data. Experience with a group purchasing organization (GPO), health care institution, or healthcare distributor/manufacturer a plus. Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel. Working knowledge of Microsoft Access, PowerPoint, and Word a plus. Some SQL and VBA knowledge a plus. Estimated Hiring Range At Vizient, we consider skills, experience, and organizational needs in our compensation approach. Geographic factors may adjust the range estimate and hires typically fall below the top range. Compensation decisions are tailored to individual circumstances. The current salary range for this role is $68,500.00 to $109,700.00. This position is also incentive eligible. Vizient has a comprehensive benefits plan! Please view our benefits here: http://www.vizientinc.com/about-us/careers Equal Opportunity Employer: Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The Company is committed to equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender identity, ethnicity, age, national origin, sexual orientation, disability status, veteran status or any other category protected by applicable law.

title: Healthcare Segment Development Manager
description: Job Summary Responsible for executing segment planning (problem –solving, fact base generation, work stream execution, drawing conclusions, drafting executive-ready presentations). Partners with account team to support account-level plan refinement. Responsible for internal preparation for major market access development efforts including the development of business development materials. Develops and executes defect-free analytics to support segment plan business development and other business for the segment. Monitors competitive insights for the team. Job Responsibilities Leads execution of planning for a Healthcare segment. Delivers assigned segment planning in Company planning cycle. Accountable for delivery of program planning for assigned segment that support meeting/exceeding plan revenue and profit targets. Ensures that major Account Plans developed by Account Team are aligned with assigned Healthcare segment priorities, provides support in selected areas. Responsible for development/ access initiatives in segment, including internal preparation, external engagement with clients, delivery (working with relevant account team, as applicable) Responsible for execution of segment strategies with pull through for all retail offerings to ensure maximum revenue growth for the Company. Partners with marketing pharmacy insights group to obtain customer-driven metrics to identify product and services that are both feasible and profitable for the Company. Provides business case to Segment leaders to support data-driven decisions on when/where to scale-up proof-of-concept differentiated customer products and services. Ensures data flow of research from several channels, including patients, payers, and healthcare providers. Provides business case to Segment leaders to support prioritization and selection of investment areas for new value propositions; Direct Segment Initiatives, Value Proposition, and/or Operation teams to ensure delivery. Ensures value proposition development aligns to strategy. Drives execution on products and services while utilizing common product/service platforms, where possible. Ensures delivery of targeted patient experience for designated segment across Company channels, balancing segment value potential and cost-to-serve. Evaluates the actual experience in each channel and provide input to channel leaders as needed to enhance the patient experience. Serves as subject matter expert proactively provides perspectives and ideas on current and emerging key issues affecting segment. About Walgreens And WBA Walgreens www.walgreens.com is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. Nasdaq WBA, an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBAs purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nations medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide. The actual salary an employee can expect to receive, plus bonus pursuant to the terms of any bonus plan if applicable, will depend on experience, seniority, geographic location, and other factors permitted by law. To review benefits, please visit jobs.walgreens.com/benefits. "An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans". Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree and at least 2 years of experience in strategic planning, strategy consulting, financial analysis AND/OR third party pharmacy in pricing, sales, marketing or business development OR a High School diploma/GED and at least 5 years of experience in strategic planning, strategy consulting, financial analysis AND/OR third party pharmacy in pricing, sales, marketing or business development. Experience contributing analytics or planning support to strategic business planning processes. Experience developing assigned parts of internal and external presentations. Experience executing and quality controlling analytics (for example: running an analysis for a specific question and returning defect-free answers). Advanced level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: using AVERAGE function, merging and centering cells, printing centered page and/or creating a pivot table). Advanced level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: changing picture styles, customizing animation and/or setting automatic slide timings). At least 1 year of direct leadership, indirect leadership and/or cross-functional team leadership. Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). Preferred Qualifications Master’s Degree/MBA At least 2 years consulting experience as an analyst or above at a global management consulting firm. Experience scoping and completing analytics. Healthcare industry experience in any sector of the US market (e.g., pharma, payer, provider) Experience with advanced databases (for example: coding SAS, SQL, etc.) Experience with data visualization (for example: Tableau, PROS, etc.) Experience writing and or delivering presentations to senior leaders in an organization.

title: Senior Analyst, Global Category Marketing
description: The Senior Analyst, Global Category Marketing will work within the Global Category Marketing function. This global function is critical in the development of the company wide annual growth marketing plan aligning T&HS Business Segments & Segment Marketers, Global Categories and Regional Marketing priorities across Ingredion, with extensive exposure to leadership, high visibility work, and driving innovation-focused projects. Furthermore, the function evaluates and sizes new growth pockets and supports global category marketing initiatives. The Senior Analyst will support these activities by performing opportunity sizing, prioritizing growth opportunities, and developing the global growth plan. The position reports to the Director, Global Category Lead T&HS, Bakery & Snacks Lead and Marketing Excellence. As a Senior Analyst, Global Category Marketing, your responsibilities will include: Development of the company wide annual growth marketing plan aligning T&HS Business Segments & Segment Marketers, Global Categories and Regional Marketing priorities across Ingredion, with extensive exposure to leadership, high visibility work, and driving innovation-focused projects Collaborating with marketers from the Business Segments, Global Category Leads, regional G2M/commercial teams, and application category leads from the global/region to support the development of the plan. Assessing the size and opportunity of potential new category markets and innovation areas of interest to Ingredion, informing the organization Where to Play Working closely with segments, regions and the Insights team to size and evaluate business opportunities. Assisting in the development of Growth Marketing Plan templates and tools to better construct and deliver the overall plan with efficiency. Prioritizing growth opportunities across Business Segments and Categories Developing or leveraging new analytical tools (e.g. PowerBI, AI-Co-Pilot, Microsoft Suite software, etc.) to accelerate data analysis and intelligence gathering, and to create efficiencies for the organization. The Senior Marketing Analyst position is well-suited for you if you bring: Experience in opportunity sizing and prioritization of business opportunities, leveraging external and internal datasets, and leveraging insights and trend analysis from the Insight Center of Excellence Experience in managing multiple stakeholders across a company. Good understanding of the food industry and its ingredient business Mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills Qualified Candidates Will Have Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience Min. of 5 years of experience in strategy or category marketing, ideally in a B2B context within the food & beverage industry. Strong strategic marketing and data analytics toolkit of methodology and practices, with experience in CPG and Food & Beverage databases (e.g. Euromonitor, Nielsen, Innova, Mintel) preferred. Strong skills in quantitatively assessing and analyzing complex data. Relocation Available? No We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Ingredion seeks to provide a work environment that is free from harassment and discrimination. We will not tolerate any form of discrimination based on race, color, religion, age, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, handicap or disability—mental or physical—marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability resulting from military service, or any other classification protected by law (“protected classifications”). We are committed to establishing and maintaining a work environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect. Relocation Available: Yes, Within Country

title: Compliance Analyst
description: Greetings Of The Day Hope you are doing great. My name is Rajan kumar As discussed please find the JD below If you are comfortable send me your updated resume POSITION Compliance Analyst LOCATION Hybrid Chicago, IL DURATION 6+ months INTERVIEW TYPE Video Job Responsibilities Support a contract management document gathering and entering them into a system Perform abandoned property reviews Support training and development monitoring Perform testing and reviews of compliance policies and procedures Assist in managing and documenting internal reviews and filings Assist with special projects, global projects and execution of automation initiatives Job Requirements Bachelor's degree in a business-related field 2+ years of experience in a financial/compliance analyst role Advanced technical skills including Excel, Access and SQL Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Critical thinking and problem solving skills Ability to work with globally diverse teams Able to communicate in oral and written form with all levels of the organization Experience in a collaborative culturally diverse and inclusive environment Demonstrated technical and team leadership skills capable of managing a team to accomplish assigned projects

title: Senior FP&A Manager / Consultant
description: We have partnered with our client in their search for a FP&A Senior Manager/Consultant in Deerfield, IL (Hybrid work schedule, flexible days). This is a 6-12-month engagement. Responsibilities Budgeting and Forecasting: Orchestrating the annual budgeting, periodic forecasting, and strategic planning processes, closely collaborating with Business Units and the Executive Leadership Team (ELT). Monthly Reporting: Compiling and presenting the monthly management reporting package, elucidating the month's performance to the ELT and Board of Directors. Analyzing monthly outcomes against historical patterns, budgets, and forecasts. Coordinating and collaborating with Corporate Functions, including ELT members, to prepare functional budgets, forecasts, and monthly variance analyses. Financial Modeling and Analysis: Assisting the FP&A Director and CFO in modeling and appraising new initiatives, scenario planning, long-term forecasts, and M&A undertakings. Administration of financial consolidation and reporting software employed for actual reporting and planning modules. M&A / Integration Endeavors: Collaborating with recently acquired entities to incorporate their reporting, forecasting, budgeting procedures, and chart of accounts. Capital Expenditure Management: Supervising the company's capital budgeting procedure, scrutinizing capital expenditure requests for compliance, furnishing project approval and expenditure status updates. Ad-hoc Reporting: Assisting the business, FP&A Director, and CFO with necessary ad-hoc reporting and analyses. Skills Required 7+ years' hands-on experience CorporateFP&A (consolidated) experience vs BU or CommercialFP&A, etc. P&L analysis, cash flow analysis, variance analysis, financial modeling (P&L modeling) Solid understanding of financial planning variables, assumptions & drivers (for a multi-business organization) Good understanding of general accounting Strong process improvement skills Self-directed, able to articulate results clearly to the CFO (so excellent communication skills) Ideally some management experience as this role will have one direct report (an analyst/we placed him) Prefer candidate withPlanful (all their businesses are on it for reporting and consolidations) - but not required / anotherERP consolidation tool is OK (Hyperion,OneStream,Anaplan,BPC, Adaptive, etc) Planning - they download the data from Planful and model in Excel Education Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related field Senior Manager, FP&A Deerfield, IL Building & Construction About Korn Ferry Korn Ferry unleashes potential in people, teams, and organizations. We work with our clients to design optimal organization structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people and advise them on how to reward and motivate their workforce while developing professionals as they navigate and advance their careers. To learn more, please visit Korn Ferry at www.Kornferry.com

title: Senior Treasury Analyst, Reporting & Integration
description: Introduction Welcome to Gallagher – a global leader in insurance, risk management, and consulting services. With a growing team of more than 45,000 professionals worldwide, we empower businesses, communities, and individuals to thrive. At Gallagher, you can build a career whether it’s with our brokerage division, our benefits and HR consulting division, or our corporate team. Experience The Gallagher Way, a culture fueled by shared values and a collective passion for excellence. Join one of our dynamic teams, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping Gallagher's future and unlocking unparalleled opportunities for both clients and yourself. We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that you’re close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply. Overview Seeking an experienced Bank Administration and Reporting Treasury Senior Analyst to join our growing team. This is a new role that will be primarily responsible for bank administration and reporting initiatives. How You'll Make An Impact Bank Administration – Support the execution and coordination of Treasury related action items associated with acquired companies’ bank account infrastructure, ongoing payments strategy, and other financial activities (cash, investments, and derivative agreements used to manage risk) Bank Administration duties as it relates to open, close bank accounts (Domestic and International). Establish banking relationships with our partnership banks. Drive continuous process improvements for Treasury’s Mergers and Acquisitions operations. Establish relationships with resources from both Treasury and other departments to assist in completion of project objectives. Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope, and within budget. Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation to monitor and track progress. Assist in managing changes to the project scope and project schedule. Perform other duties and functions as assigned. Reporting and Integration - Analyze Operating and Cash flow reporting – standalone and consolidation. Work with finance teams and business units to create daily global cash reports timely and accurately. Responsible for ongoing and ad hoc reporting for senior management Utilize Treasury Workstation BI tools to provide global business performance analysis across multiple business units – research issues that arise from Global Ops reporting. Proactively lead continuous process improvement efforts to optimize and improve the cash forecasting model on an ongoing basis. Update and Track acquisitions per assigned division – banking and liquidity. Update Visio – Bank schematics. Project management – work with other Treasury groups on assigned projects. Perform other duties and projects as assigned. About You Required: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Accounting or related field. CPA/CTP is a plus. 4 years related experience required (working in project management, financial modeling, analysis, or forecasting role for large firm) International Exposure Proficiency in MS Office and Treasury Management Workstations. Proficient at navigating banking portals Must have strong quantitative analytical skills to work effectively across functions and business teams. Strong analytical skills with a deep understanding of treasury and banking activities Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication/presentation skills. Demonstrated ability and aptitude for managing multiple projects under deadline constraints. Strong analytical skills and proven track record utilizing treasury workstation and financial models to create and analyze reports. Able to multi-task in a fast-paced, work independently, deadline driven. Strong computer skills including intermediate Excel, cash modeling, and reporting. Demonstrated ability to analyze, model, communicate and present large amounts of data for leadership and other stakeholders. Detail oriented with ability to maintain accuracy, attention to detail, investigate issues and creative thinking. Preferred : MBA, CTP and/or CPA preferred. Banking Experience Behaviors: Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively. Compensation And Benefits On top of a competitive salary, great teams and exciting career opportunities, we also offer a wide range of benefits. Below are the minimum core benefits you’ll get, depending on your job level these benefits may improve: Medical/dental/vision plans, which start from day one! Life and accident insurance 401(K) and Roth options Tax-advantaged accounts (HSA, FSA) Educational expense reimbursement Paid parental leave Other benefits include: Digital mental health services (Talkspace) Flexible work hours (availability varies by office and job function) Training programs Gallagher Thrive program – elevating your health through challenges, workshops and digital fitness programs for your overall wellbeing Charitable matching gift program And more... We value inclusion and diversity Click Here to review our U.S. Eligibility Requirements Inclusion and diversity (I&D) is a core part of our business, and it’s embedded into the fabric of our organization. For more than 95 years, Gallagher has led with a commitment to sustainability and to support the communities where we live and work. Gallagher embraces our employees’ diverse identities, experiences and talents, allowing us to better serve our clients and communities. We see inclusion as a conscious commitment and diversity as a vital strength. By embracing diversity in all its forms, we live out The Gallagher Way to its fullest. Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any form of discrimination by its managers, employees, vendors or customers based on race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy status), sexual orientation, gender identity (which includes transgender and other gender non-conforming individuals), gender expression, hair expression, marital status, parental status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected (herein referred to as “protected characteristics”) by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

title: Business Development Manager
description: Royal Cyber, Inc. has openings for Business Development Manager in Naperville, IL Job Title: Business Development Manager Job Duration: Full-Time/40 Hours a week/Permanent Job Duties: Identify new business opportunities within assigned accounts. Responsible for farming new business acquisition by selling technology services. Managing existing accounts, responsible for the growth of the accounts in terms of revenue and invoice clearance. Accountable for the delivery of software development and attending weekly calls with the client for project review. Responsible for achieving individual revenue growth and targets. Closely working with pre-sales and technical teams to prepare decks and proposals to acquire new business for the organization. Interacting and consulting with leadership executives to sell IT services and maintain relationships. Handling the new leads right after setting up the appointment, lead qualification, converting lead into new opportunity, approvals, and deal closure. Building sales pipeline, negotiation and deal closing. Contributing towards the development and implementation of the overall organization's strategy. Understand the business goals (revenue growth, profitability, proportionate share of revenue from design services and solutions) of the organization and work towards achieving the same. Prepare Commercial Proposals and Negotiate contracts & licensing agreements with Customers & Partners independently and with complete discretionary powers. Construct high level marketing research reports to identify potential customers and Technologies to invest and grow business. Contract review and negotiations with customers. Formulating and implementing the strategic plan that guides the direction of the business or organization. Evaluating the success of the organization and maintaining awareness of both the external and internal competitive landscape, opportunities for expansion, customers, markets, new industry developments and standards, and so forth. Ensure the delivery of high-quality services while managing current and future growth. Job Requirements: Required Bachelor’s or foreign equivalent in Business Administration, Management, Marketing, Computer Science, or any related field + 2 years of experience in the job offered, Sales Officer, Manager, Analyst or related. Must be able to travel/relocate to various client sites throughout the US. Salary Range: $115,482.00/Year to $120,000.00/Year Location of Work: Royal Cyber, Inc. 55 Shuman Blvd, Suite # 275 Naperville, IL 60563 To apply, please send resumes to HR Manager, Royal Cyber, Inc.,55 Shuman Blvd, Suite # 275, Naperville, IL 60563 or Email: hr.us@royalcyber.com

title: Senior Energy Analyst
description: This role will be dedicated to one of JLL’s largest clients, a global leader in technology and innovation. You will be working alongside the world’s leading technologists and innovators, helping them to achieve their ambitious 2030 Sustainability Commitments. What This Job Involves As a Senior Energy Analyst in the Sustainable Operations team, you analyse client energy usage to help identify opportunities to reduce consumption through programs, procedures, and investments. You will be dedicated to a leading technology client with facilities across North and South America, and will have the support of a full-time energy manager, a utility operations team, and a sustainability programs lead. You are a Subject Matter Expert in energy consumption analytics and sustainability practices, particularly in the fields of utility cost management, common building energy-consuming equipment, and decarbonization. Energy Conservation and Improvement Opportunities Investigate and recommend process improvements to conserve energy Support the implementation of energy and water conservation projects Convert findings and proposals into compelling presentations to justify investments Maintain trackers and databases related to IoT devices, energy-consuming equipment, and refrigerants Analytics and Utility Account Management Assist in the management of client utility accounts, and provide accurate and timely intelligence of how energy is used across the portfolio Contribute to monthly and quarterly utility budget reviews and forecasts Report program progression and results to the client and internal technical services teams Develop tools and templates to identify saving opportunities, generate reports, and build dashboards that inform strategic energy management activities Maintain the client's Energy Star portfolio Sound like you? To apply you need to be: Required BA/BS in Math, Science, Engineering, Environmental Sciences, or related technical degree 2+ years’ experience with energy/sustainability conservation services. Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong written and oral communication skills. Proficiency in spreadsheet software with experience in data analysis. Experienced in managing simultaneous complex tasks from inception to successful completion. Preferred Possession of, or ability to obtain, an appropriate, valid driver’s licence. Experience working within a facilities management, construction, or technical services environment LEED or CEM accreditation Engineer in Training (EIT) status Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and stay organised. Self-motivated with excellent attention to detail and ability to work autonomously. Well-versed in the effective use of technology and tools including database query, script development, rapid analysis of large data sets, remote collaboration tools, and generative AI. Demonstrated experience with building automation systems and/or energy modelling software is preferred

title: Forensic and Integrity Services - eDiscovery SDC Senior Analyst
description: EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Location: Dallas, Houston, Chicago, Washington DC, New York, Hoboken. The Discovery Services solution in Forensics is a Managed Service operation running 24/7 with both internally facing operational roles and client facing consulting roles. This team is responsible for providing remote collections, evidence management, data processing, review support, and production services in support of investigations and litigation. This portfolio includes several high-profile matters and flagship clients. The opportunity The Senior Analyst position in Discovery Operations is a supervisory position tasked with oversight of the e-discovery operations team to manage all e-discovery operational tasks that are submitted through our internal workflow management tool. Over 70% of time will be spent assisting with quality control and oversight of work performed by analysts. Your Key Responsibilities Ensure proper chain of custody and documentation is established to comply with EY standards and polices Assist in execution of e-discovery operational tasks, including remote collections, evidence management, data processing, review support, and productions, as needed. Perform quality control and oversight of e-discovery operational tasks executed by Analysts. Assist in the remediation of technical errors as they arise by following the tasks and technical protocol given the relevant Software (e.g. Nuix, Relativity, etc.) for the specific job function requirement. Prepare and perform quality control standard reports as needed. Following up with Analysist to review any QC concerns flagged for remediation. Assist in providing training on an as needed basis. Assist in updating and maintaining internal documentation/playbooks as needed by reviewing internal protocol standard methodology, and refreshing appropriately as new releases of the software are published, or as new data sources are available. Responsible for quality control and oversight of request that are routed through our workflow management tool. Skills And Attributes For Success To qualify for the role you must have Bachelor degree required 3-5 years eDiscovery experience 1-2 years experience in an information technology (IT) environment, preferably including understanding of how databases are set up and designed. Supervisory experience Experience or familiarity with the following suite of e-discovery applications: Encase, LAW, Nuix, Relativity, Brainspace, eCapture, and SQL. Demonstrated experience in the e-Discovery lifecycle including document collection, evidence management, data processing, review support and production. Professional demeanor and strong communication skills, both written and oral in order to communicate with engagement teams and e-discovery operations team members. Strong attention to detail. Ability to balance multiple concurrent projects and requests. Able to work a flexible schedule to meet client and project requirements and deadlines The ability and willingness to travel and work in excess of standard hours when necessary Access to reliable transportation to/from the EY office and client sites. A driver's license is strongly recommended as ride share and public transportation options may not be available in all locations Ideally, you’ll also have Certification in one of the following: Nuix, Relativity, Ipro, eCapture, Brainspace, Encase is preferred. What We Look For We’re interested in people that have a passion for using technology to solve problems. But we’re not just looking for strong technical skills – we’re interested in people that have the ability to nurture relationships – both internal and external – and are committed to intimately understanding our client’s needs. If you’re looking to become part of a community of advisors where you’ll make a measurable difference across some of the most prestigious businesses around, this role is for you. What We Offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. title: Emerging Risk Consultant
description: The Emerging Risks Group specializes in connecting risk and strategy for our clients through the deployment of predictive analytics analyzing risk in our clients’ value chains. The group is made up of four verticals - Cyber, ESG and Climate, Geopolitical Risk, and Operational Resiliency. Our team members serve as trusted, strategic risk advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear data-driven choices about managing risk to drive growth and enterprise value through delivery of deep industry expertise, rigorous analytical capabilities, and a pragmatic approach to solve our client’s most complex business and risk challenges. Emerging Risk Group is seeking candidates for the following position to be ideally based in New York or Chicago, but we will accept remote candidates : Emerging Risk Consultant What can you expect? Identify risk to growth and value creation strategies (both insurable and non-insurable losses) Evaluate the appropriate business models, operating models, and capabilities to support their strategic vision and de-risk their operating environment Address both operational and strategic risks to our clients’ operating models Maximize the ROI on risk capital Strong interpersonal and influencing skills What is in it for you? A company with a strong brand, with experience developing solutions for todays and tomorrow’s toughest challenges A culture of internal mobility, diversity, inclusion, and collaboration Employee Resource Groups which provide access to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities, and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and client organizations Flexible work opportunities for work/life balance Competitive pay and a full benefits package, starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, Vision, Short- and Long-Term Disability and Life Insurance, Employee Stock Purchase program, and a generous paid time-off allowance); plus a fixed company contribution AND a company match on your 401k, after one year of service We will count on you to: Have a passion for learning, professional growth and knowledge sharing A desire to be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-paced and fun team environment Experience assessing strategy and making recommendations to clients Show strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment Knowledge of or experience in broader operations functions (i.e. HR, IT, Finance, Procurement, Commercial Operations, Cybersecurity) Have strong interpersonal skills What you need to have: Bachelor's degree with a record of outstanding academic achievement 4+ years of relevant consulting or prior experience in a research or business analyst role Strong quantitative and analytical skills Excellent written and verbal communication What makes you stand out? Undergraduate major in in economics, engineering, finance or accounting or an advanced degree in business (e.g., MBA) from a top tier program Experience and comfort in using analytical methods to create project analysis and recommendation support Ability to build Excel, Python and or R operating models Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marshmclennan.com, follow us on LinkedIn and X. Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, veteran status (including protected veterans), or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by contacting TANA@mmc.com Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person. The applicable base salary range for this role is $84,000 to $179,200. The base pay offered will be determined on factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, education, and any applicable minimum wage requirements. Decisions will be determined on a case-by-case basis. In addition to the base salary, this position may be eligible for performance-based incentives. We are excited to offer a competitive total rewards package which includes health and welfare benefits, tuition assistance, 401K savings and other retirement programs as well as employee assistance programs. title: US Mobility Senior Analyst
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com As a member of the US Mobility team, you’ll work with a fast-paced technology team where you’ll make a meaningful difference for the US mobile device users including corporate owned devices and BYOD devices. As a Senior Mobility Analyst, you’ll foster key relationships with users, understand their mobile needs, provide informative and tailored service, and recommend solutions that will enable their ability to work anywhere. Additionally you will engage or lead key Mobility projects interfacing with Enterprise Mobility teams, track required documentation and reviews of Mobility administrative oversight to the US program and put together rollout and support plans including communications. You’re flexible to work CIBC support hours, typically 8-5pm CT but may include evenings and weekends with advance notice. To help deliver a great user experience, you’re flexible to work at multiple locations within a reasonable travel distance. At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, you’ll be on-site full-time. How you will succeed: User engagement – Meet with users to understand and guide on Mobility issues, advise them on solutions, and provide support information for future needs. Use your knowledge of other end user support functions to help direct them to the right resources.
